message:
Well, for one thing, this post is a more general approach for "async-local" data. It *can* be used as a diagnostic causation-stack, but it can just as easily be used to store other contextual data (i.e., a kind of application-specific HttpContext).

However, I did look into LogicalOperationStack when you commented, and it turns out that it does (correctly) use the logical call context, but it (incorrectly) uses a mutable stack. So it will not operate correctly when your code uses asynchronous concurrency (i.e., Task.WhenAll).
